page.title: 11NORWOOD PARK - THE FARM
page.content: Norwood Park is a dairy farm of 250 acres with about 260 cows. They use a system of strip grazing where the herd is confined to a small area of grass, surrounded by electric fencing. The following day they are given a new area to graze. The fields are cut for silage and the cut grass is stored under black plastic until it is needed to feed the cows in the winter. The cows are milked at 5am and 3pm each day. The modern milking parlour milks 10 cows at a time. The cow's identity number is typed into a computerised system which feeds each cow the correct amount of high protein cake and records the amount of milk given. The milk is chilled ready to be taken away. As well as meadow land the farm has a small 14 acre apple orchard. The apples are sold for commercial cider making.
